load_data module¶

The module loads all game characters from PostgreSQL database

Module requires sqlalchemy - to work with the PostgreSQL database, uuid4 - to generate a unique identifier for protagonist, os and dotenv to load environment variables, copy - to deepcopy quests for different, persons, character_classes to use game characters, tables - to use ORM table models, fill_data - to fill database tables, if the database has not yet been created, phrases - to load player and character lines

load_data.add_items_weapons_quests(person: Protagonist | NPC | Enemy, t_person: Person, data: Dict[str, Any]) → None¶

Add items, weapons and quests from tables to person

Parameters:

  • person (Union[c.Protagonist, c.NPC, c.Enemy]) – The person to whom the things are issued

  • t_person (t.Person) – The person’s ORM model

  • data (Dict[str, Any]) – The loaded data

load_data.add_std_equipment(person: Protagonist | NPC | Enemy, data: Dict[str, Any]) → None¶

Adds initial weapon, armor and items for person

Parameters:

  • person (Union[c.Protagonist, c.NPC, c.Enemy]) – The person to whom the items are issued

  • data (Dict[str, Any]) – The loaded data from db

Raises:

ValueError – If any standart item not in database

load_data.copy_attr(item: Item | Weapon | Quest, t_item: Item | Weapon | Quest) → Item | Weapon | Quest¶

Copy attributes from ORM models to game classes

Parameters:

  • item (Union[c.Item, c.Weapon, c.Quest]) – Game class

  • t_item (Union[t.Item, t.Weapon, t.Quest]) – ORM model

Returns:

Copied game class

Return type:

Union[c.Item, c.Weapon, c.Quest]

load_data.copy_persons(person: Protagonist | NPC | Enemy, t_person: Person) → None¶

Copy ORM person model to game person model

Parameters:

  • person (Union[c.Protagonist, c.NPC, c.Enemy]) – Game model

  • t_person (t.Person) – ORM model

load_data.create_db_and_user(args: Namespace | None) → bool¶

Checking the database and user, if doesn’t exist, creates it

Parameters:

args (Optional[Namespace]) – The command line arguments

Raises:

ValueError – If CVC environment variables didn’t set

Returns:

True if database created

Return type:

bool

load_data.get_session() → Session¶

Returns session from session factory

Returns:

Returns PostgreSQL sessions

Return type:

Type[Session]

load_data.loader(data: Dict[str, Any], save_id: int, args: Namespace | None, is_init_load: bool) → Dict[str, Any]¶

Loads all game data from PostgreSQL database

Parameters:

  • data (Dict[str, Any]) – Dictionary with init information

  • save_id (int) – Load with modified parameters from saves or not

  • args (Namespace) – Need or not drop database, change or append values,

  • is_init_load (bool) – Is starts game from load

Returns:

The dictionary with all game needed data

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]
